name: Beastmen
background:
Beastmen are a coalition of different species of bestial humanoids, which rely on ambush tactics to overwhelm their enemies.

Over the centuries, the Beastmen lived together in the southern savannah of Tyria, building great cities and trading prosperously. The opening of the Rift destroyed many of their cities, and Daemons drove them from their home. Most of the Beastmen have fled north, surviving by raiding and scavenging while they seek a new home.
backgroundFull:
The vast savannah in southern Tyria had been inhabited by wildlife since the beginning of time. At the center of the largest watering hole of the land, a giant lush tree provided shade and food, and from its roots a magical substance seeped into its fruit. Over many generations, the animals that ate the fruit of this tree slowly changed and became sentient, and came to see the tree as sacred, settling around it in peace.

Gradually, the different tribes of Ndoli, Waheni, Hapari, Ndwari, Kemba, and Silombi learned to co-exist and formed a confederacy of closely knit tribes. The Beastmen built a great civilization in the savannah, constructing a great capital city around the Holy Tree, and a network of smaller cities around, which expanded out through the grasslands and connected the watering holes around it. For centuries, the Beastmen tribes lived lives of peace and prosperity on the Savannah.

Then, the Rift opened. It tore through the Savannah, damaging the Holy Tree and destroying many of their cities. When the Daemons began to emerge, most Beastmen were forced to abandon their homeland. The only thing that remains of their old civilization are the ruins of their cities, and the dried out remains of the Holy Tree, whose once crystalline waters have now turned black.

Some Beastmen still call these ruins their home, but there is no hope that it will flourish once again in the future. Others have begun to wander along the edge of the Rift, towards the heart of Tyria. In order to survive, they raid settlements and burn forests to build equipment and camps. Each amongst the Beastmen has their own reason for this great migration. Some hope to find a new home, while others seek to understand the cause of the rift. There are others who have become accustomed to raiding and violence, and take any opportunity to destroy the homes of others, just as their own homes were destroyed.

How will you guide your tribe?

gains.name: Light Chariot
gains.label: Light Chariot (Tusks (A2), Armor(4), Fast, Impact(4), Tough(6))

options.label: Light Chariot (Tusks (A2), Armor(4), Fast, Impact(4), Tough(6))

spells.name: Surge of Power
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Bestial Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Flock Attack
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with AP(1) and Surge. Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spells.name: Hunting Roar
spells.effect: Pick up to four enemy units within 18", which get -1 to morale test rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? this.getMoraleCost({ ...unit, quality: Math.max(1, unit.quality - params.effect.rollModifier.value) }) - this.getMoraleCost(unit) : 0

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getMoraleCost({ quality: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value }) - this.getMoraleCost({ quality: 5 })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Ancestral Wrath
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy models within 24", which take 1 hit with Tear each.

spells.name: Spirit Mantle
spells.effect: Pick up to six friendly units within 12", which get Regeneration once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Destructive Flame
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 12", which take 3 hits each.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Precision Shooter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +1 to hit rolls when shooting. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Crush
specialRules.description: When it's this model's turn to attack in melee, roll X dice. For each 6+ the target takes one hit with AP(2).

specialRules.name: Repel Ambushers
specialRules.description: Enemy units using Ambush must be set up over 12" away from this model's unit.

specialRules.name: Melee Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's melee weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Bestial
specialRules.description: When attacking, targets must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6 when blocking hits from this model's weapons.

specialRules.name: Ambush Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Ambush. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Piercing Assault. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Furious Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Furious. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Melee Evasion. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Shred in Melee
specialRules.description: This model gets Shred in melee.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Tear
specialRules.description: Against non-Hero units with Tough(3) or more, this weapon gets AP(+4).

specialRules.name: Bestial Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Bestial Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Morale Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which gets -1 to morale test rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Precision Tag
specialRules.description: Once per game, during this model's activation, pick one enemy unit within 36" and in line of sight of it, and place X markers on it. When attacking, friendly units may remove markers from their target before rolling to hit to get +Y to hit rolls, where Y is the number of removed markers.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9 away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush cant seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when charging.

specialRules.name: Furious
specialRules.description: When charging, unmodified results of 6 to hit in melee deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls in melee when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Bestial Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Bestial, enemies taking hits from it must re-roll successful unmodified defense results of 5-6 from Bestial (instead of only on 6).

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.
